alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 11 at 10:53AM MST until January 13 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, extreme cold expected. Wind chills as low as 65 below zero at high elevations and as low as 50 below zero along Highway 2. * WHERE...Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Essex, Polebridge, Marias Pass, and Bad Rock Canyon. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
